You will need a pencil or pen to complete this portion Are you ready?
When questions are complete Thank you for your patience and for answering these previous questions. Please note that we will keep this information with your research records. As I mention before, some of your responses may be shared with our Football Player Health Study staff members and you may be contacted to participate in additional research opportunities. I have recorded your answers to the questions and these will be reviewed by a study physician to determine whether you are eligible for the study. May I put you on a brief hold while I finish that up? For example, we will ask them to tell us if you need reminders or help with activities such as keeping track of appointments, household chores and personal care. We will also ask them to tell us about your mood for example, if you get anxious or irritated. This will entail a brief phone call with the individual you decide to provide contact information for. Following the phone call, we will send them an individualized link via email which will contain a 23 -question survey. This survey will not contain any identifiable information for instance, it will not contain your name, address, or birthdate and your family member will not be asked to provide this information either. Do we have your permission to speak to someone that knows you well? references: dynamic_model__ipa_ps_informant_detail: from: master add: one_to_master creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: tmoca_1 dynamic_model__ipa_ps_tmocas: tmoca_score: condition: <= value: 19 not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: informant_details save_trigger: on_create: create_reference: - activity_log__ipa_assignment: in: master with: extra_log_type: schedule_informant_screener notes: ADL Informant Screener required based on T-MoCA result. associated_activity_logs.name: IPA Tracker
associated_activity_logs.extra_log_types:
_definitions:
  enabled_if: &enabled_if

    # if performed a phone screening no consent to continue, disable after 14 days
    not_all_not_interested:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          select_is_good_time_to_speak: not interested
          select_may_i_begin: not interested
          select_still_interested: 'no'

      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if recorded a withdraw activity, disable after 14 days
    not_all_withdraw:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          select_subject_withdrew_reason: withdrew
          select_investigator_terminated: 
            - yes - due to ae
            - yes - other reason
          lost_to_follow_up_no_yes: 'yes'
          no_longer_participating_no_yes: 'yes'
      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not eligible, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ineligible:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not interested in participating, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ps_followup_not_interested:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if the exit survey has been completed, disable after 14 days
    not_all_complete:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: follow_up_surveys
      dynamic_model__ipa_surveys:
        select_survey_type: exit survey     
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

  ref_filestore_container: &ref_filestore_container
    nfs_store__manage__container: 
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
      view_as:
        edit: hide
        show: filestore
        new: not_embedded

  save_trigger:
    on_create_filestore_container: &create_filestore_container
      create_filestore_container: 
        name: general files
        label: General Files
        create_with_role: nfs_store group 600


  

_default:
  view_options:
    hide_unless_creatable: true

  showable_if: *enabled_if
  creatable_if: *enabled_if
  editable_if: *enabled_if


schedule_screening:
  label: Schedule Screening
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes for the screener    
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - screening_follow_up

  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener
    select_record_from_player_contacts:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_record_from_player_contact_phone

  showable_if:
    always: true





schedule_informant_screener:
  label: Schedule Informant Screener
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the informant screening?
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: informant_details

        
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - perform_screening_follow_up  
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_inex_checklists:
        extra_log_type: sign_phone_screen


  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener

  references:
    ipa_ps_informant_detail:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master





screening_follow_up:
  label: Schedule Screening Follow Up
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening follow up?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    not_all:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 
          - 'yes'
          - 'no'
        
  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener
    select_record_from_player_contacts:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_record_from_player_contact_phone

      
perform_screening_follow_up:
  label: Perform Screening Follow Up
  references:
    ipa_screening:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  caption_before:
    all_fields: |
      Record the eligibility of the participant and any additional notes needed to perform the phone screening follow up.
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_inex_checklists:
        extra_log_type: sign_phone_screen
    not_all:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 
          - 'yes'
          - 'no'
        

  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if: 
    always: true

  save_trigger:
    on_create:
    
      create_reference:
      
        - activity_log__ipa_assignment:
            if: 
              all:
                dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
                  id: 
                    this_references: id
                  select_is_good_time_to_speak: 
                    - left voicemail
                    - 'no'                      
                    
            in: master
            with:
              extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
              select_who: current_user_email
              follow_up_when: 
                dynamic_model__ipa_screenings: 
                  id:
                    this_references: id
                  callback_date: return_value
              follow_up_time: 
                dynamic_model__ipa_screenings: 
                  id:
                    this_references: id
                  callback_time: return_value
              notes: Screening follow up call when to voicemail or participant requested a call back
              select_record_from_player_contacts:
                activity_log__ipa_assignments:
                  extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
                  select_record_from_player_contacts: return_value


appointment:
  label: Appointment
  fields:

  references:
    ipa_appointment:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: perform_screening_follow_up
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'yes'
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 'yes'


contact_info:
  label: Emergency Contacts
  fields:

  references:

    emergency_contact:
      from: master
      add: many   

  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment


mrn:
  label: MRN
  fields:

  references:
    mrn_number:
      from: master
      add: many   
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment

  save_trigger:
    on_create:
      notify:
        type: email
        role: clinical research coordinator
        layout_template: ipa notification layout
        content_template: ipa message content
        subject: "IPA App: Subject MRN assigned"
 

transportation_and_housing:
  label: Transportation and Housing
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_transportation:
      from: master
      add: many
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
    ipa_hotel:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment

consent_mailing:
  label: Consent Mailing
  fields: 
  references:
    ipa_consent_mailing:
      from: master
      add: one_to_this

payments:
  label: Payments
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_payment:
      from: master
      add: many
      limit: 2
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    

withdraw:
  label: Withdraw
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_withdrawal:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: schedule_screening

  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if:
    always: true

follow_up_surveys:
  label: Follow Up Surveys
  fields: 
  references:
    ipa_survey:
      from: master
      add: many
      limit: 2
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type:
          - appointment
  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if:
    always: true


general:
  label: General Communications
  fields:
    - select_activity
    - activity_date
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - select_record_from_addresses
    - select_direction
    - select_who
    - select_result
    - select_next_step
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes

  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener

  caption_before:
    select_record_from_player_contacts: The phone or email address, or...
    select_record_from_addresses: ... mailing address for the communication 
    select_result: Is a follow up required, or is this communication complete?
    notes: Notes regarding this communication or to assist with the follow up
  show_if:
    select_next_step:
      select_result: follow up
    follow_up_when:
      select_result: follow up
    follow_up_time:
      select_result: follow up

files:
  label: Files

  save_trigger:
    on_create:
      <<: *create_filestore_container 

  references:
    <<: *ref_filestore_container

associated_dynamic_models.options: default: field_options: select_regarding_dressing: edit_as: field_type: regarding_dressing_yes_no_dont_know caption_before: select_regarding_eating: | Regarding eating Which best describes {{player_info.first_name}}'s usual performance during the past 4 weeks? select_regarding_walking: Regarding walking (or getting around in a wheelchair), in the past 4 weeks, which best describes his/her optimal performance select_regarding_bowel_and_bladder: Regarding bowel and bladder function at the toilet, which best describes his/her usual performance in the past 4 weeks select_regarding_bathing: Regarding bathing, in the past 4 weeks, which best describes his/her usual performance select_regarding_grooming: Regarding grooming, in the past 4 weeks, which best describes his/her optimal performance select_regarding_dressing: | Regarding dressing, in the past 4 weeks Did {{player_info.first_name}} select his/her first set of clothes for the day? select_regarding_dressing_performance: If yes, which best describes his/her usual performance select_regarding_getting_dressed: Regarding physically getting dressed, which best describes his/her usual performance in the past 4 week used_telephone_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} use a telephone select_telephone_performance: If yes, which best describes his/her highest level of performance watched_tv_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} watch television? selected_programs_yes_no_dont_know: | If yes, ask all questions. Did {{player_info.first_name}} usually select or ask for different programs or his/her favorite show? talk_about_content_during_yes_no_dont_know: usually talk about the content of a program while watching it? talk_about_content_after_yes_no_dont_know: talk about the content of a program within a day (24 hours) after watching it? pay_attention_to_conversation_yes_no_dont_know: | In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} ever appear to pay attention to conversation or small talk for at least 5 minutes? Note: {{player_info.first_name}} did not need to initiate the conversation. select_degree_of_participation: If yes, which best describes his/her usual degree of participation clear_dishes_yes_no_dont_know: Did {{player_info.first_name}} clear the dishes from the table after a meal or snack? select_clear_dishes_performance: If yes, which best describes how he/she usually performed find_personal_belongings_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} usually manage to find his/her personal belongings at home? select_find_personal_belongings_performance: If yes, which best describes how he/she usually performed obtain_beverage_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} obtain a hot or cold beverage for him/herself? (A cold beverage includes a glass of water) select_obtain_beverage_performance: If yes, which describes his/her highest level of performance make_meal_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} make him/herself a meal or snack at home? select_make_meal_performance: If yes, which best describes his/her highest level of food preparation dispose_of_garbage_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} dispose of garbage or litter in an appropriate place or container at home? select_dispose_of_garbage_performance: If yes, which best describes how he/she usually performed get_around_outside_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} get around (or travel) outside of his/her home? select_get_around_outside_performance: If yes, which best describes his/her optimal performance go_shopping_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} ever go shopping? select_go_shopping_performance: Which one best describes how {{player_info.first_name}} usually selects items pay_for_items_yes_no_dont_know: Did {{player_info.first_name}} usually pay for items without supervision or physical help? keep_appointments_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 week, did {{player_info.first_name}} keep appointments or meetings with other people such as relatives, a doctor, the hairdresser etc.? select_keep_appointments_performance: If yes, which best describes his/her awareness of the meeting ahead of time institutionalized_no_yes: Is the participant institutionalized? left_on_own_yes_no_dont_know: | In the past 4 weeks, was {{player_info.first_name}} ever left on his/her own? NOTE: Being taken to day care or having a sitter at home does not constitute being left alone. away_from_home_yes_no_dont_know: | Was {{player_info.first_name}} left: away from home, for 15 minutes or longer, during the day? at_home_more_than_hour_yes_no_dont_know: at home, for an hour or longer, during the day? at_home_less_than_hour_yes_no_dont_know: at home, for less than 1 hour, during the day? talk_about_current_events_yes_no_dont_know: | In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} talk about current events? This means events or incidents that occurred during the past month. did_not_take_part_in_yes_no_dont_know: | Did {{player_info.first_name}} talk about events that... he/she heard or read about or saw on TV but did not take part in? took_part_in_outside_home_yes_no_dont_know: "{{player_info.first_name}} took part in outside home involving family, friends, or neighbors?" took_part_in_at_home_yes_no_dont_know: events that occurred at home that he/she took part in or watched? read_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} read a magazine, newspaper or book for more than 5 minutes at a time? talk_about_reading_shortly_after_yes_no_dont_know: | Did {{player_info.first_name}} usually: talk about details of what he/she read while or shortly (< than 1 hour) after reading? talk_about_reading_later_yes_no_dont_know: talk about what he/she read 1 hour or longer after reading? write_yes_no_dont_know: | In the past 4 weeks, did {{player_info.first_name}} ever write things down? NOTE: If {{player_info.first_name}} wrote things only after encouragement or with help, the response should still be 'yes' select_write_performance: If yes, which best describes the most complicated things that he/she wrote pastime_yes_no_dont_know: In the past 4 week, did {{player_info.first_name}} perform a pastime, hobby or game? multi_select_pastimes: | If yes, which pastimes did he/she associated_dynamic_models.name: Inclusion Exclusion Checklist
associated_dynamic_models.options:
default: caption_before: ix_consent_blank_yes_no: Subject able to give informed consent and willing and able to comply with study procedures ix_consent_details: Notes ix_not_pro_blank_yes_no: Not a former professional football player ix_not_pro_details: Notes ix_age_range_blank_yes_no: Aged 24-55 ix_age_range_details: Notes ix_weight_ok_blank_yes_no: Weight 450lbs ix_weight_ok_details: Notes ix_no_seizure_blank_yes_no: No history of seizure disorder ix_no_seizure_details: Notes ix_no_device_impl_blank_yes_no: No device implants such as cardiac pacemakers or perfusion pumps that cannot be removed. ix_no_device_impl_details: |

Additional Notes

Documentation is required to assess MR safety. This should be obtained from the participant prior to the visit and scanned / uploaded in the Supporting Files activity to allow review.

ix_no_ferromagnetic_impl_blank_yes_no: No ferromagnetic implants or objects that cannot be removed such as aneurysm clips, surgical clips, prostheses, artificial hearts, valves with steel parts, metal fragments, shrapnel, tattoos near the eye, or steel implants or jewelry ix_no_ferromagnetic_impl_details: Notes ix_diagnosed_sleep_apnea_blank_yes_no:

Phase 2-specific
Must meet criteria for at least one of below

Self-report of having had a healthcare provider diagnose sleep apnea

ix_diagnosed_sleep_apnea_details: Notes ix_diagnosed_heart_stroke_or_meds_blank_yes_no: "Self-report of having had a healthcare provider diagnose heart attack or stroke or having ever been prescribed or currently taking medications for two of the three following conditions: hypertension, diabetes, or high cholesterol" ix_diagnosed_heart_stroke_or_meds_details: Notes ix_chronic_pain_and_meds_blank_yes_no: Self-report of chronic pain and current management of chronic pain by either over the counter or prescription medication or alternative therapies ix_chronic_pain_and_meds_details: Notes ix_tmoca_score_blank_yes_no: Telephone Montreal Cognitive Assessment (T-MoCA) score of 19 out of 22 total points ix_tmoca_score_details: Notes ix_no_hemophilia_blank_yes_no:

QST

No history of hemophilia

ix_no_hemophilia_details: Notes ix_raynauds_ok_blank_yes_no: No moderate to severe Raynauds disease ix_raynauds_ok_details: Notes ix_mi_ok_blank_yes_no: No recent MI ix_mi_ok_details: Notes ix_bicycle_ok_blank_yes_no:

Cardiac

Able to sit on and pedal a bicycle

associated_reports.name: Search IPA Subject
associated_reports.description:
Search subjects by name, phone, email or ID.
Leave the search field empty to see all subjects.
associated_reports.sql:
select distinct m.id master_id, 
pi.first_name, pi.middle_name, pi.last_name, pi.nick_name,
a.street, a.street2, a.city, a.state, a.zip, 
pc.data, pc.rec_type
from masters m
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = m.id 
inner join ipa_assignments b
on m.id = b.master_id
left join addresses a
on m.id = a.master_id
left join player_contacts pc
on pc.master_id = m.id
where 
(:name is null 
or pi.first_name ~* :name
or pi.last_name ~* :name
or pi.middle_name ~* :name
or pi.nick_name ~* :name
or( 
    pi.first_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 1),'none')
    AND pi.last_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 2),'none')
  )
) OR
(
regexp_replace(pc.data, '\W+', '', 'g') ~* regexp_replace(:name, '\W+', '', 'g')
) OR
(
b.ipa_id::varchar = :name
)
associated_reports.search_attrs:
name: 
  text: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviation PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_severity = 'major'


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Event PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_relatedness IN ('related', 'possibly related') AND p.select_expectedness = 'unexpected'
 AND (p.select_location = 'internal' OR p.select_severity = 'serious')


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Outstanding Activities
associated_reports.description: Search for records where one activity has been performed and another hasn't been performed after it (optional).
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT
   dt.master_id,
   pi.first_name,
   pi.last_name,
   dt.source,
   dt.extra_log_type activity,
   dt.communication_result,
   dt.checklist_signed,
   dt.exit_type,
   dt.created_at,
   dt.r
FROM (

  SELECT
    di.*,
    dlo.exit_type,
    rank()
    OVER (
    PARTITION BY di.master_id
    ORDER BY di.created_at DESC
    ) AS r
  FROM
  (
    SELECT
      al.master_id,
      'tracker' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      al.select_result "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      al.created_at

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al

    WHERE
    :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='follow up'
    OR
    :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='completed'
    OR
    :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general'
    OR
    :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general'
    OR
    (
      al.extra_log_type IN (:activity_performed, :activity_outstanding, 'withdraw', 'perform_screening_follow_up')
    )

    UNION

    SELECT
      inex.master_id,
      'inex' "source",
      inex.extra_log_type,
      NULL "communication_result",
      inex.signed_no_yes "checklist_signed",
      inex.created_at


    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_inex_checklists inex
    WHERE

    (:activity_performed IN ('inex-phone-screen-complete', 'inex-baseline-complete') OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND :activity_outstanding IN ('inex-phone-screen-complete', 'inex-baseline-complete') )
    AND extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen', 'sign_baseline')

    UNION

    SELECT
      ps.master_id,
      'phone screen' "source",
      'phone_screen_finalized' "extra_log_type",
      NULL "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      ps.created_at


    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_phone_screens ps
    WHERE

    (:activity_performed = 'phone-screen-complete' OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND :activity_outstanding  = 'phone-screen-complete' )
    AND extra_log_type IN ('finalize')



    

  ) AS di

  LEFT OUTER JOIN (

    SELECT
      master_id,
      'not interested or ineligible (follow up)' "exit_type"


    FROM ipa_screenings ps
    WHERE
      still_interested_blank_yes_no = 'no' OR
      eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'


    UNION

    SELECT
      master_id,
      'not interested (phone screening)' "exit_type"

    FROM ipa_ps_initial_screenings inits
    WHERE
     select_is_good_time_to_speak = 'not interested' OR
     select_may_i_begin = 'not interested' OR
     select_still_interested = 'no'

    UNION

    SELECT
      master_id,
      'withdrew' "exit_type"

    FROM ipa_withdrawals wd
    WHERE
     select_subject_withdrew_reason = 'withdrew' OR
     select_investigator_terminated IN ('yes - due to ae', 'yes - other reason') OR
     lost_to_follow_up_no_yes = 'yes' OR
     no_longer_participating_no_yes = 'yes'

     UNION

    SELECT
      master_id,
      'completed exit survey' "exit_type"
    FROM ipa_surveys surv
    WHERE
      select_survey_type = 'exit survey'
  ) dlo ON dlo.master_id = di.master_id

) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id

WHERE
(:activity_outstanding IS NULL OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND r = 1)
AND
(

  :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
  OR
    :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
  OR (
    :activity_performed = 'inex-phone-screen-complete'
    AND (
      dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen') AND
      checklist_signed = 'yes'
    )
  )
  OR (
    :activity_performed = 'inex-baseline-complete'
    AND (
      dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_baseline') AND
      checklist_signed = 'yes'
    )
  )
  OR (
    :activity_performed = 'phone-screen-complete'
    AND (
      dt.extra_log_type IN ('phone_screen_finalized')
    )
  )
  OR :activity_performed NOT IN ('inex-complete', 'phone-screen-complete') AND dt.extra_log_type = :activity_performed
)
AND (
  :activity_outstanding IS NULL
  OR NOT (
    r = 1
    AND (
      :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
      OR (
          :activity_outstanding = 'inex-phone-screen-complete'
          AND (
            dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen') AND
            checklist_signed = 'yes'
          )
      )
      OR (
          :activity_outstanding = 'inex-baseline-complete'
          AND (
            dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_baseline') AND
            checklist_signed = 'yes'
          )
      )

      OR (
        :activity_outstanding = 'phone-screen-complete'
        AND (
          dt.extra_log_type IN ('phone_screen_finalized')
        )
      )
      OR :activity_outstanding NOT IN ('inex-complete', 'phone-screen-complete') AND dt.extra_log_type = :activity_outstanding
    )
  )

)
AND (
  :completed_or_withdrawn IS NULL 
  OR (
    :completed_or_withdrawn = 'in_study' AND dt.exit_type IS NULL
    OR
    :completed_or_withdrawn = 'not_in_study' AND dt.exit_type IS NOT NULL
  )
)
ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
activity_performed: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-follow-up
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      phone screen complete: phone-screen-complete
      inclusion/exclusion phone screen review: inex-phone-screen-complete
      inclusion/exclusion baseline review: inex-baseline-complete
      payment made: payments
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw


activity_outstanding: 
  config_selector: 
    label: Activity outstanding (optional)
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-completed
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      phone screen complete: phone-screen-complete
      inclusion/exclusion phone screen review: inex-phone-screen-complete
      inclusion/exclusion baseline review: inex-baseline-complete
      payment made: payments
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw


completed_or_withdrawn: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: in_study
    selections: 
      in study: in_study
      completed or withdrawn: not_in_study

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviation Initial Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring initial review by the Senior Clinical Research Coordinator.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id, a2.extra_log_type, a.created_at,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type IS NULL
 AND p.select_severity = 'major'


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type IS NULL

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Event Initial Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring initial review by the Senior Clinical Research Coordinator.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.extra_log_type, a.created_at, a.master_id,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type IS NULL


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type IS NULL


ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Events
associated_reports.description:
IPA Adverse Events report for fast review of events requiring additional action or for summary reporting.

The activities are performed in this order: initial submission, initial review, PI review (if required), report to IRB (if PI review was required)

NOTE: the Last Activity Performed represents the last recorded activity for a specific adverse event. Therefore to find outstanding tasks, for example items requiring Report to IRB, it is necessary to search for the last activity that was performed, PI Review in this example.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id,
coalesce(dt.created_at, dt.submitted_at) "last activity",
coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') "Last Activity Performed",
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
select_severity, select_location, select_relatedness, select_expectedness, event_occurred_when, event_discovered_when,
dt.primary_extra_log_type,
dt.primary_activity
FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id , a.id "primary_activity", a.extra_log_type "primary_extra_log_type", a.created_at "submitted_at", a2.created_at, a2.extra_log_type, p.select_severity, p.select_location, p.select_relatedness, p.select_expectedness,
   p.event_occurred_when, p.event_discovered_when,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id


 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE r = 1 
AND (:event_occurred_from IS NULL OR event_occurred_when >= :event_occurred_from)
AND (:event_occurred_to IS NULL OR event_occurred_when <= :event_occurred_to)
AND (:severity IS NULL OR select_severity = :severity)
AND (:location IS NULL OR select_location = :location)
AND ((:relatedness) IS NULL OR select_relatedness IN (:relatedness))
AND ((:expectedness) IS NULL OR select_expectedness = (:expectedness))
AND ((:latest_activity) IS NULL OR coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') IN (:latest_activity))

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
severity: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_severity
    multiple: single
    default: serious
location: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_location
    multiple: single

relatedness: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_relatedness
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - related
      - possibly related

expectedness: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_expectedness
    multiple: single

event_occurred_from: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: -15 days
event_occurred_to: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
latest_activity: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    label: Latest Activity Performed
    selections: 
      initial submission: initial submission
      initial review: initial_review
      pi review: pi_review
      report to irb: report_to_irb

associated_reports.name: IPA In Process & Exited
associated_reports.description: All subjects that have joined or exited the study: in process (phone screening scheduled), completed, withdrawn, ineligible, not interested (during phone screen or follow-up)
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT * from (
SELECT distinct dt.master_id, 
CASE 
WHEN extra_log_type = 'follow_up_surveys' THEN 'completed'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'withdraw' THEN 'withdrawn'
WHEN ps_interested1 = 'not interested' OR ps_interested2 = 'not interested' OR ps_still_interested = 'no'
  THEN 'not interest during phone screening'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up' AND eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'
  THEN 'ineligible'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up' AND follow_up_still_interested = 'no'
  THEN 'not interest during screening follow-up'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'schedule_screening' THEN 'in process'
ELSE extra_log_type
END "status", 
pi.first_name, pi.last_name ,
dt.created_at "when"
-- , ps_interested1, ps_interested2, ps_still_interested
FROM 
(
SELECT
al.master_id, al.created_at, al.extra_log_type,
ipa_screenings.eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no, ipa_screenings.still_interested_blank_yes_no "follow_up_still_interested", 
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_is_good_time_to_speak "ps_interested1",
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_may_i_begin "ps_interested2",
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_still_interested "ps_still_interested",
rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY al.master_id 
  ORDER BY al.created_at DESC
 ) AS r

FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al
LEFT JOIN ipa_screenings
ON al.master_id = ipa_screenings.master_id
LEFT JOIN ipa_surveys
ON al.master_id = ipa_surveys.master_id
LEFT JOIN ipa_ps_initial_screenings
ON al.master_id = ipa_ps_initial_screenings.master_id
WHERE
(
(
  ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_is_good_time_to_speak = 'not interested' 
  OR ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_may_i_begin = 'not interested'
  OR ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_still_interested = 'no'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up'
  AND ( 
    ipa_screenings.eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'
    OR ipa_screenings.still_interested_blank_yes_no = 'no'
  )
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'follow_up_surveys'
  AND ipa_surveys.select_survey_type = 'exit survey'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'withdraw'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'schedule_screening'
)
)
) dt
INNER JOIN player_infos pi
ON dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE r = 1 
) dt2
WHERE status IN(:select_status)
ORDER BY status, "when" desc
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
select_status: 
  config_selector:
    label: Select / de-select statuses to report  
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - ineligible
      - completed
      - withdrawn
      - in process
      - not interest during phone screening
      - not interest during screening follow-up
    selections: 
      ineligible: ineligible
      completed: completed
      withdrawn: withdrawn
      in process: in process
      not interest during phone screening: not interest during phone screening
      not interest during screening follow-up: not interest during screening follow-up

associated_reports.name: IPA Appointments & Assessments
associated_reports.description: View all scheduled calls, communication follow-ups, phone screenings and planned assessment events in a chronological list, split week by week.
associated_reports.sql:
create temp table nav_events
as select
'' "-",
al.event_date,
al.start_time,
pi.master_id,
ipa.ipa_id,
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
al.extra_log_type,
al.select_status,
al.select_station,
al.select_event_type,
al.other_event_type,
al.completion_time,
al.arrival_time,
al.select_navigator
from
activity_log_ipa_assignment_navigations al
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = al.master_id
inner join ipa_assignments ipa
on ipa.master_id = al.master_id

where
(:from_date IS NULL or event_date >= :from_date)
AND (:to_date IS NULL or event_date <= :to_date)
AND ((:type) IS NULL or extra_log_type in (:type))
AND ((:confirmed) IS NULL or select_status in (:confirmed))
AND ((:station) IS NULL or select_station in (:station))
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
;


create temp table appointments
as select
visit_start_date,
ap.master_id,
ipa.ipa_id,
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
max(ap.id) appointment_id
from ipa_appointments ap
inner join activity_log_ipa_assignments al
on al.master_id = ap.master_id

inner join player_infos pi
on ap.master_id = pi.master_id

inner join ipa_assignments ipa
on ipa.master_id = al.master_id


where
  visit_start_date IS NOT NULL
  AND (:from_date IS NULL or visit_start_date >= :from_date)
  AND (:to_date IS NULL or visit_start_date <= :to_date)
  AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
GROUP BY
ap.master_id, visit_start_date, pi.first_name, pi.last_name, ipa.ipa_id
;

create temp table scheduled_calls
as select
  dt.follow_up_when,
  dt.follow_up_time,
  dt.master_id,
  ipa.ipa_id,
  p.first_name,
  p.last_name,
  dt.extra_log_type,
  dt.select_who
from
  (
    select a.master_id,
      a.extra_log_type,
      a.select_who,
      a.follow_up_when,
      a.follow_up_time,
      a.notes,
      rank()
    OVER (
      PARTITION BY a.master_id, a.extra_log_type
      ORDER BY a.created_at DESC
    ) AS r

    from activity_log_ipa_assignments a
    where
      follow_up_when is not null
      AND (:from_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when >= :from_date)
      AND (:to_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when <= :to_date )
  ) dt
inner join player_infos p
  on dt.master_id = p.master_id

inner join ipa_assignments ipa
  on dt.master_id = ipa.master_id

WHERE r = 1
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
;

create temp table all_dates
as 
select event_date from nav_events
union
select follow_up_when from scheduled_calls
union
select visit_start_date from appointments
;

SELECT
  al.event_date "date",
  al.start_time "start time",
  'assessment event' "-",
  al.extra_log_type "type",
  select_navigator "assigned to",
  al.master_id,
  al.ipa_id "IPA ID",
  al.first_name "first name",
  al.last_name "last name",
  al.select_status "status",
  al.select_station "station",
  al.select_event_type "event type",
  al.other_event_type "other event type",
  al.completion_time "planned or actual completion time",
  al.arrival_time "arrival time"

FROM nav_events al

UNION

SELECT
  date_trunc('week', dd)::date,
  NULL,
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  NULL,
  NULL,
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM generate_series
      ( (select min(event_date)::timestamp from all_dates)
      , (select max(event_date)::timestamp from all_dates)
      , '7 day'::interval) dd

UNION

SELECT
  visit_start_date event_date,
  NULL,
  'appointment start',
  '',
  '' "assigned to",
  master_id,
  ipa_id,
  first_name,
  last_name,
  '',
  '',
  '',
  '',
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM appointments

UNION

SELECT
  follow_up_when,
  follow_up_time,
  'scheduled call' "-",
  extra_log_type,
  select_who "assigned to",
  master_id,
  ipa_id,
  first_name,
  last_name,
  '',
  '',
  '',
  '',
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM scheduled_calls


order by
"date",
"start time"
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
from_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

to_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

type: 
  config_selector: 
    label: Assessment Event Type (planned or feedback)
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    selections: 
      planned: planned_event
      event feedback: station_event
    default: 
      - planned_event

confirmed: 
  general_selection: 
    label: Planned Assessment Event Status
    item_type: activity_log__ipa_assignment_navigation_select_status
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - unconfirmed
      - confirmed
      - in progress

station: 
  general_selection: 
    label: Assessment Event Station
    item_type: activity_log__ipa_assignment_navigation_select_station
    multiple: multiple
ipa_id: 
  number: 
    label: IPA ID
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviations
associated_reports.description:
IPA Protocol Deviations report for fast review of events requiring additional action or for summary reporting.

The activities are performed in this order: initial submission, initial review, PI review (if required), report to IRB (if PI review was required)

NOTE: the Last Activity Performed represents the last recorded activity for a specific protocol deviations. Therefore to find outstanding tasks, for example items requiring Report to IRB, it is necessary to search for the last activity that was performed, PI Review in this example.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id,
coalesce(dt.created_at, dt.submitted_at) "last activity",
coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') "Last Activity Performed",
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
select_severity, deviation_occurred_when, deviation_discovered_when,
dt.primary_extra_log_type,
dt.primary_activity
FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id , a.id "primary_activity", a.extra_log_type "primary_extra_log_type", a.created_at "submitted_at", a2.created_at, a2.extra_log_type, p.select_severity, 
   p.deviation_occurred_when, p.deviation_discovered_when,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id


 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE 
r = 1 
AND (:deviation_occurred_from IS NULL OR deviation_occurred_when >= :deviation_occurred_from)
AND (:deviation_occurred_to IS NULL OR deviation_occurred_when <= :deviation_occurred_to)
AND (:severity IS NULL OR select_severity = :severity)
AND ((:latest_activity) IS NULL OR coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') IN (:latest_activity))

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, my name is ____, and I am calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. Is Mr. {{player_info.last_name}} available?

I am reaching out to talk to you about the In-Person Assessment research study. Is this a good time to speak?

Voicemail

Hi, my name is ____ and Im calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. When you have a chance please call me back at 617-432-5000. I look forward to speaking with you. Thank you

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro overview
associated_message_templates.template:
As you may know, The Football Players Health Study is a research initiative dedicated to understanding the current health and well-being of former NFL players. The purpose of the in-person assessments is to learn more about the long-term health effects of a career in professional football.

Participation will involve a 2 day study visit in Boston that includes assessments of areas such as pain and physical function, memory/thinking/problem solving, sleep, heart function, and brain imaging. All nights will be spent in a local hotel. The visits will take place at various Harvard-affiliated institutions. Throughout the study, a member of the study team will guide you through all of the visits. All transportation, meal and lodging costs will be covered by the Study.

By participating, you will be helping us better understand player health. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to learn more about yourself as we will be providing some results from the clinical assessments at the end of the study. At the participants request, these can be shared with a health care provider for further guidance and interpretation.

I am going to go over the study in some more detail. If you have any questions while I explain the study please stop me and ask. Do you have any questions so far?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro details
associated_message_templates.template:
INTERVIEWER: HAVE THE CONSENT FORM ON HAND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DETAILS ABOUT THE STUDY VISITS AS NEEDED.

Day 0

Our team will coordinate your arrival to Boston to arrive the day before the study begins. Your first night will be spent in a local hotel.

Day 1

Day 1 will begin at MGH where you will review the consent form with a study physician and study coordinator. Any specific questions you have will be answered then. You will then go through a general assessment of your health similar to a physical at a doctors appointment and have your blood drawn. You will have to fast prior to this blood draw. You will then have a DEXA scan which is similar to an x-ray but it looks at bone density. In the afternoon, you will go through two PET scans, a sense of smell test and a test of your sensory responses. The day will end around 6pm.

  • Consent review: The first day will start with a review of the consent. You will meet with a study coordinator and the study physician in order to review the study assessments and the consent form. During this time, you will be able to ask any questions or voice any concerns you may have.
  • OGTT: Once have agreed to participate, you will get your blood drawn. Please note that will ask that you do not eat for at least 8 hours prior to this blood draw we will be sure to remind you when you arrive. You will have breakfast following the blood draw.
  • During the rest of the first day you will:
    • Undergo an assessment of your health such as a review of your medical history, medications, and a brief physical exam that includes body composition measures (e.g. height, weight, waist size)
    • Fill out some questionnaires about your health
    • Undergo a DEXA scan. A DEXA scan is similar to an x-ray, but it is a scan that looks at your bone density and body composition.
    • PET (Positron Emission Tomography) with CT (Computed Tomography) PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that light up inside the body to make a picture. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures. You will complete two different PET scans.
    • Sense of smell testing (olfactory) This brief test consists of breathing different odors from a small handheld odor delivery device and being asked questions about your familiarity, memory and ability to name each odor.
    • Sensory testing An assessment that consists of tests to measure your sensory responses for example, having pressure applied to different parts of your body or putting you hand in ice water you will be asked to report when these sensations are uncomfortable.
  • The first study night will be spent in the hotel.

Day 2

On the second full study day, you will begin with neuropsychological testing. After this, you will have an MRI of your brain and your liver. In the afternoon, you will travel to a different hospital to do physical functioning testing. After physical functioning, you will go through our TMS and EEG assessment. TMS is noninvasive and uses magnetic fields to measure connectivity in the brain. The day will end at the hotel where you will be set up for the sleep assessment. You will sleep with various sensors on your body to analyze your sleeping patterns.

  • Neuropsychological testingn assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems. This will be conducted with a trained neuropsychologist.
  • MRI (Magnetic resonance imaging) of your brain and liver This is a scan that takes pictures of your brain and liver using a large magnet and radio signals.
  • Physical function testing Testing that consists of a series of tests such as lifting weights, a timed walking test, walking upstairs carrying weights, walking while doing another task (simple math), and testing your balance. These assessments will be administered and overseen by a trained exercise physiologist.
  • TMS (Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation) and EEG (Electroencephalogram) The TMS will measure brain plasticity. Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. The magnetic field is produced by a coil that is held next to your scalp. In this study, we will use TMS to create activity in your brain and will measure your brains response to the activity. This is how we measure brain plasticity. During the TMS assessment, you will have a series of electrodes (small round discs) will be placed on your head and your brain waves will be measured while you sit quietly and then while you complete a few simple tasks on a computer.
  • Sleep study - During the second night, you will have a sleep study in the Clinical Research Center at Massachusetts General Hospital. This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate, breathing and brain waves while you sleep. A trained technician will assist you in placing various sensors on your body. Additionally, you will be asked to complete several questionnaires on your sleep habits.

Day 3

On the third and final study day, you will begin with cardiac testing and then X-rays. After you have completed all of the assessments, we will be returning some preliminary results from your testing. Our medical navigation nurse will meet with you and discuss some of the results. Some results will be reported to you in the coming weeks and that process will be explained to you at that time.

  • Cardiac testing This testing consists of activities such as having pictures taken of your heart (ultrasound), assessment of your resting metabolic rate which will include you having to wear light headgear with a breathing tube, and a bicycle exercise test.
  • X-rays You will undergo an X-ray exam, where you will be asked several questions, prepped and asked to stand in the equipment for the duration of the scan.
  • Results Return At the end of your last day we are going to go over some of the results that we collected so that you have something to take away

Are you still interested in hearing more about the study or do you have any questions at this time?

Would you be willing to answer questions about your health and medical history to find out if you might qualify for the study? This should take about 30 minutes and you will receive a $20 gift card for your time. Do you have time now to continue?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 1
associated_message_templates.template: The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. The study doctors have reviewed the information you provided and determined that you have met the criteria to participate in the study. Is this something you are still interested in participating in?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, may I please speak to Mr. {{player_info.last_name}}?

My name is XX, and I am calling (or following up) from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University in regards to our in-person assessment. Is this a good time to speak?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 2
associated_message_templates.template:
Would you like me to review the details about the study again?

The study will take place at multiple hospitals in the Boston area over 2 1/2 days with overnight stays at a local hotel. Each day will consist of different testing. You will be provided with your personal study visit schedule ahead of your visit. You will be given breaks and meals throughout the days.

You will be assigned a study navigator, a member of the Football Players Health Study staff, who will accompany you throughout each day of the study. The navigator will assure that you get to each test. They will also handle scheduling issues or conflicts and provide assistance and act as a resource to you throughout the study.

Your mornings will begin between 5-7am and will end around 6-7pm, depending on the schedule for that particular day. Each day will begin with a review of that days schedule and any questions you may have will be answered. Each day will end with a review of how the procedures went. We may contact you after you complete the study visit with additional questions and follow-up.

The first day of the study a study navigator will greet you and a study physician will review the consent form with you and help to answer any questions that you have. A nurse practitioner will conduct a baseline physical exam and collect information about your health and medical history. Over the next two and a half days, you will undergo assessments such as PET/CT scans, sense of smell test, neuropsychological testing, MRI scans, physical function assessments, TMS and EEG, an overnight sleep study, cardiac testing, pain assessments, and an X-ray exam.

Compensation up to $1800 will be given to you for your time and efforts involved in participating in this study. In order to pay you, you will need to provide your Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). Your payment will be processed 30 days after the study visit. You will need to fill out a W9 and any other pertinent tax information in order to receive payment.

Just as a reminder, we will cover the costs of your transportation, (parking), lodging and meals during the study visit. (ask where they are coming from)

Do you have any questions?

Thank you for your time today.

We will send you additional study information to review and our travel partners will be contacting you to make arrangements for your visit to Boston.

Please feel free to contact us at any time should you have any questions.

END CALL

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call not eligible
associated_message_templates.template:
The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. The study doctors have reviewed the information you have provided and have determined that the in-person assessments study is not a good fit for you. As a reminder, simply because you are not a good fit for this particular study does not mean that you will not have the opportunity to participate in other Football Players Health Study research studies. Do we have permission to contact you in the future?

You will be receiving a gift card for taking the time to answer our questions. Thank you very much for your time.

Confirm contact information and END CALL.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro complete intro
associated_message_templates.template:
There are some questions about sensitive medical information involved and some of the questions may make you feel uncomfortable. I will also be asking you to do some tasks in order to assess your attention and memory such as repeating sentences or numbers back to me. You can stop at any time.

I will record your answers on a secure database, and we will keep these answers even if you decide that you dont want to continue in the study. This information will be stored in our secure database and may be combined with other information from other Football Players Health Studies that you have been involved in. If you do qualify for this study, we will collect detailed information to schedule your visit such as your date of birth, insurance information, an emergency contact, social security number, and address. This information will be discarded if you decide that you dont want to be in this study. The risk of allowing us to collect and record your name with your answers is a loss of confidentiality.We will take reasonable steps to protect the confidentiality of your information.

As previously mentioned, you will receive a $20 gift card for your time today learning about the study and answering some questions about your health and medical history. Could you please provide me with and/or confirm your contact information so that I can send you this?

CHECK ATHENA (Participant Details Tab) FOR CORRECT CONTACT INFORMATION

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call needs partner
associated_message_templates.template:
If study subject meets eligibility criteria BUT is required to bring study partner

The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. The study doctors have reviewed your information and invite you to participate; however, they would like you to bring a study partner to Boston. This can be a spouse, adult child, your adult sibling, your parent or your legally authorized representative. We will cover all costs for your study partner to come with you. Do you have any questions?

If subject no longer wants to participate - thank them for their time, remind them they can participate in other FPHS research studies, and end call.
